alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 11:44PM AKST until January 22 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW ACROSS THE CENTRAL PANHANDLE... .Snowfall continues across the panhandle. Dry snow will become wetter through the event with central-southern areas transitioning to rain. For northern areas, it is possible that snow lasts longer Monday night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow and freezing rain. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Petersburg Borough. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Horizontal surfaces may become very slippery under a thin glaze of ice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to increase in water content through the duration of the event.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
